title: Ticket #3124: "pipeFullWrite: Unable to write to fd" If startd hooks ignore stdin
description:
If the startd is feeding significant input to a hook, and the hook ignores it, the startd will complain with message like this: 

DaemonCore::PidEntry::pipeFullWrite: Unable to write to fd 65590 (errno = 32).  Aborting write attempts.

This is not good. It's noise in the log file. If one decided to investigate it, it's not obvious what the source is. You can't even determine what the read FD is. (The FD is obfuscated to discourage other sections of code from doing overly clever things with it. Subtract 65536 to find the real FD.)

Should hooks be allowed to ignore, not even reading, stdin?

  • If so, we shouldn't complain at all. (Or if we must, downgrade it to D_FULLDEBUG)
  • If not
    • we should document that it isn't allowed
    • we should provide a more useful error message explaining the problem.

To reproduce:

  1. Create a simple fetchwork hook:
    #! /usr/bin/perl -w
use strict;

print <<END;
Cmd="/bin/sleep"
Args="3600"
Owner="adesmet"
JobUniverse=5
Requirements=TRUE
RequestCpus=1
RequestMemory=8
RequestDisk=1024
END

exit 0;
  2. Add the following to your configuration file, changing the path as appropriate:
    STARTD_JOB_HOOK_KEYWORD = ALAN
ALAN_HOOK_FETCH_WORK=/scratch/adesmet/V7_8-branch/release_dir/hooks/fetch-work-infinite
FetchWorkDelay=1
  3. Start up Condor.
  4. Check StartLog, observe regular complaints similar to:
    07/11/12 15:53:17 DaemonCore::PidEntry::pipeFullWrite: Unable to write to fd 65537 (actually 1) (errno = 32).  Aborting write attempts.
